review_title: Horrible pay/raises, no support from management
pros: Great 401K, HSA, and that's about it.
cons: The union is less than desirable. Pay is not commiserate with workload. Pay raises are not 2% or cost of living, averaging around $0.55. You will work harder than you ever have, while other RT's hide and skirt their assignment without offense. The doctor's order needless tests and procedures. One Rt will be assigned four or more floors without backup. There is no accountability for leaving unclean equipment, not setting up clean equipment, or not setting up equipment correctly. The hospital is understaffed and ill managed.

review_title: They only care about money, not patients or employees.

cons: Management will pretend they care about their employees but in reality they just pocket bonus after bonus and go on vacation multiple times a year.

job_title: Patient Access Representative in Richland, WA

cons: Very low wage, starts at $13.82, barely above minimum wage. This is a very complex, stressful job and a lot to learn. On the job training period is very difficult. They are always short staffed. Providence does not staff appropriately for the amount of work to be done. They way under pay for this position, which is so vital to the success of Kadlec.

review_title: Kadlec - A Friendly, Committed, and Exciting Place To Work
pros: Friendly and knowledgeable staff committed to improving patient care. The first place I've worked for where the management recognizes that to make money long term you need to produce a better product (in this case service) and retain good employees. Great opportunities to move around to different departments and gain tons of experience. A place that I can see working at long term/build a career. It is the healthcare leader in the region and its employees are proud to uphold that tradition. Kadlec does a great job of staying up with new technologies and offers their patients a wide range of options and expertise. A place you can work at and truly feel fulfilled and happy at the end of the day while making a competitive living. Located in a smaller community whose economy is heavily dependent upon a government contract. Fortunately, that contract will probably be around for a long time making the economy more resistant to recession.
cons: Kadlec has a very flat organizational structure making it difficult to "climb the corporate ladder" for those interested in that.

pros: I had a great first 10 years ,then the job position was eliminated. This affected over a dozen long term successful women. The care of patients I feel is top notch.
cons: The Planetree philosophy was not applied to the employees. Employee voices are not heard by upper management. When the job position I and others were in was eliminated new jobs were to be made available. The way it was handled was horrible and for myself and two others we were put into a position with needed training that was promised and did not happen. They said they didn't have the budget but new hires were directed to training before being placed in their position. Sadly it became true that they replaced some employees with two less expensive ones.

review_title: Kadlec - a great place to work
pros: A quality workplace, actually patient focussed with real concern for employees. I've never worked for a place before where the senior leadership walked the walk they talked, and demonstrated a truely caring and responsible community attitude. The hospital is more concerned about doing the right thing than showing a profit, and what often follows is profitable, They built an entire new patient tower without any tax or government handouts, while the other local hospital complains bitterly about their facilities and asks for handouts to help them build more floorspace while they continue to mismanage what they have.
cons: Living next to a nuclear waste facility,

review_title: Good benefits, okay pay,  terrible management
job_title: Food Service Worker in Richland, WA
pros:
The insurance is pretty good, even for part time. The pay is decent, especially if you work nights and/or weekends and as a meal service rep, but if you were in the coffee shop you won't make as much.
You do get your foot in the door for other positions around the hospital.
cons: Understaffing, meaning there is no such thing as a flexible schedule. They hire you for part time and then give you full time hours, even if you are in school. The managers have terrible communication with each other and with their employees. There is blatant favoritism.

review_title: Lots of good and bad after becoming Providence
pros:
-Pay is decent, we received wage increases after Providence affiliation
-Staff is great, RN's and doctors are great to work with
-Schedule is flexible, able to raise family and balance work
-Many experienced caregivers in department
cons:
-Benefits worsened after Providence affiliation, PTO was decreased and EIB was taken away
-Unsafe staffing ratios/unrealistic workloads, NICU RT will have NICU and multiple floors/units
-Management is not present
-No perks and no appreciation

job_title: Health Information Technician in Richland, WA

cons: I have nothing negative to say.  Greatest place I've worked for, and was sad to have to leave due to moving.  If I move back I wouldn't think twice to apply again.  I love it there.
